label: AB4C2D6_mC52_15_e_2f_f_3f-001
title: $\beta$-CuCrP$_{2}$S$_{6}$ Structure
comments:
The layered compound CuCrP$_{2}$S$_{6}$ is found in two phases (Moriya, 2005): \begin{itemize} \item \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC2D6_mP40_7_2a_2a_4a_12a-001}{low temperature $\alpha$-CuCrP$_{2}$S$_{6}$}, stable below 186K, and \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB4C2D6_mC52_15_e_2f_f_3f-001}{room temperature $\beta$-CuCrP$_{2}$S$_{6}$} (this structure). \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-0.25in} 
 There is also a magnetic transition at 30K. 
 The copper sites in $\beta$-CuCrP$_{2}$S$_{6}$ are only partially occupied, with their positions being ``simulated'' before refinement.  The occupations were estimated at 33\% for Cu I and 17\% for Cu II. Presumably only four copper atoms are present in any unit cell. 
 The designations ``$\alpha$'' and ``$\beta$'' do not appear elsewhere, we have adopted them for clarity.
